definitions.definition: after a long time, typically involving difficulty or delay.
examples: he finally arrived to join us
synonyms: at (long) last; Morein the long run
in the fullness of time "she finally got her man to the altar"

definitions.definition: as the last in a series of related events or objects.
examples: a referendum followed by local, legislative, and, finally, presidential elections
synonyms: wrap the ribbon around the edge"

definitions.definition: used to introduce a final point or reason.
examples: finally, it is common knowledge that travel broadens the horizons

definitions.definition: in such a way as to put an end to doubt and dispute.
examples: to dispel finally the belief that auditors were clients of the company
synonyms: once and for all "this should finally dispel that common misconception"
